SEARCH
Package oogasalad.editor.view.tools

Class PrefabPlacementTool

java.lang.Object
oogasalad.editor.view.tools.PrefabPlacementTool
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObjectInteractionTool
public class PrefabPlacementTool extends Object implements ObjectInteractionTool
Tool for placing selected prefabs (Blueprints) onto the editor grid. Handles sprite resolution before delegating placement to the controller.
Author:
Tatum McKinnis

    • interactObjectAt

      public void interactObjectAt(double gridX, double gridY)
      Handles interaction (click) on the grid to place the currently selected prefab.
      Specified by:
      interactObjectAt in interface ObjectInteractionTool
      Parameters:
      gridX - X-coordinate on the grid
      gridY - Y-coordinate on the grid

    • resolveSpriteForPlacement

      private Optional<BlueprintData> resolveSpriteForPlacement(BlueprintData originalPrefab)
      Checks if the prefab's sprite exists. If not, prompts the user to locate it or proceed without. Returns an Optional containing the (potentially updated) BlueprintData or empty if cancelled.

    • getCurrentGameSpriteDirectory

      private String getCurrentGameSpriteDirectory()
      Gets the expected sprite directory path for the current game. Handles potential errors if the game directory isn't set.

    • handleMissingSprite

      private Optional<BlueprintData> handleMissingSprite(BlueprintData originalPrefab, String currentGameSpriteDir, String relativePath)
      Displays an alert to the user about the missing sprite and handles their choice (locate, place without, cancel).

    • createMissingSpriteAlert

      private Alert createMissingSpriteAlert(String relativePath, String prefabType)
      Creates the Alert dialog for missing sprites.

    • createPrefabWithEmptySprite

      private BlueprintData createPrefabWithEmptySprite(BlueprintData prefab)
      Creates a copy of the BlueprintData but with an empty/null SpriteData record.

    • handleLocateSprite

      private Optional<BlueprintData> handleLocateSprite(BlueprintData prefab, String currentGameSpriteDir)
      Handles the process of letting the user locate the sprite file using a FileChooser and updates the BlueprintData if successful.

    • showLocateSpriteFileChooser

      private Optional<File> showLocateSpriteFileChooser()
      Shows the FileChooser dialog for the user to select the sprite file.

    • copySpriteAndUpdatePrefab

      private Optional<BlueprintData> copySpriteAndUpdatePrefab(BlueprintData prefab, File selectedFile, String currentGameSpriteDir)
      Copies the selected sprite file to the game's sprite directory and creates updated BlueprintData.

    • determineTargetFileName

      private String determineTargetFileName(SpriteData oldSpriteData, File selectedFile)
      Determines the target filename for the copied sprite. Uses the original filename if possible, otherwise falls back to the selected file's name.

    • createUpdatedBlueprintData

      private BlueprintData createUpdatedBlueprintData(BlueprintData prefab, String newRelativePath)
      Creates a new BlueprintData instance with the updated sprite file path.
